alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Deaf Smith; Donley; Gray; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 19 at 2:55PM CST until February 20 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM CST SUNDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM to 7 PM CST Sunday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been for strong winds and low relative humidity from Monday morning through Monday evening. * Affected Area...In Texas...Oldham...Potter...Carson...Gray... Deaf Smith...Randall...Armstrong...Donley and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph on Sunday. Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph on Monday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 7 percent on Sunday, and as low as 10 percent on Monday. * Red Flag Threat Index...3 to 5 on Sunday, and 4 to 6 on Monday. * Timing...Late morning through early evening both days.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.

area.areaDesc: Armstrong; Carson; Deaf Smith; Donley; Gray; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall
